ygData.subject: RE: Switching items
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks for the help! The part that confused me is I thought when you pressed the hot key, that had the same effect as clicking on the button. So I could click
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks for the help! The part that confused me is I thought when you pressed
the hot key, that had the same effect as clicking on the button. So I could
click on my weapon, that would pick it up, click on the empty inventory
slot, that would put it in there, et.. So I could change from my weapon and
shield to my instruments with just a few keystrokes.
Oh well, has anyone tried to get this changed? It only makes sense to have
these keys work the same as the rest of them.

Thanks again for the assistance!
Leaflay


> -----Original Message-----
> From: James Schuldes [SMTP:jgs@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, August 24, 1999 1:40 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Switching items
>
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> You still have to mouse - drag & drop. Even though we call them "hot keys"
> they are really just place to mouse - side by side and visible while in
> the
> 'normal' view mode (ie: you don't have to open the inventory screen.)
>
> So my hot key pallet is like this:
>
> 1 inv - 1 melee
>
> 2 inv - 2 melee
>
> 3 inv - 7 inv
>
> With stuffs set for battle:
>
> 1 inv (empty) - 1 melee Ashenwood Spear
>
> 2 inv Mandolin - 2 melee Dragoon Dirk
>
> 3 inv Drum - 7 inv Flute
>
> So now to switch to heal mode: click Ashenwood, click Mandolin, click
> Dirk,
> click empty spot and you will see:
>
> 1 inv Dirk - 1 melee (empty)
>
> 2 inv Ashenwood - 2 melee Mandolin
>
> 3 inv Drum - 7 inv Flute
>
> Hope that helps!
>
> Sylly Songsynger
> Bard of the 22st song
> Selling Swords and Such
> somewhere on Innoruuk
>
>
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ben Wilson [mailto:bwilson@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, August 24, 1999 12:32 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Switching items
>
> From: Ben Wilson <bwilson@...>
>
> Hi,
> I have tried to figure out how to do this, and I'm at a
> terrible loss. I
> made hot keys for my melee slots, 1 and 2, and I made a hot
> key for an
> inventory slot. When I try any of these hot keys, nothing
> happens. It would
> make my life SO much easier if I could figure out how to do
> this. If someone
> wouldn't mind stepping through the process exactly how it
> should be done, I
> would be eternally grateful. This is my first bard, and I'm
> having a blast,
> made lv10 this weekend!
>
> Thanks,
> Leaflay
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: claudio gante [SMTP:gante@...]
> > Sent: Monday, August 23, 1999 10:49 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Switching items
> >
> > From: "claudio gante" <gante@...>
> >
> > You can assign inventory slots to HotKeys,
> > Just like any other assign, press a slot with your
> left mouse
> > button
> > for 2 seconds then drop it in the hot key, do the same
> with your primary
> > and secondary weapon slots and u will have a fast way to
> swap them.
> > []'s Kel
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Matthew Horne <mjhorne@...>
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com <eqbards@onelist.com>
> > Date: Segunda-feira, 23 de Agosto de 1999 09:12
> > Subject: [eqbards] Switching items
> >
> >
> > >From: "Matthew Horne" <mjhorne@...>
> > >
> > >G'day.. im a newbie bard on the solusek ro server and i
> have a question
> > to
> > >ask.
> > >Is there any way to quickly swap items.. say a drum and a
> sword? thanks
> > for
> > >your help...
> > >
> > >lumaiea
